009package imagingbook.common.filter.linear;
010
011import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
012
013/**
014 * This class represents a 1D filter kernel.
015 * 
016 * @author WB
017 * @version 2020/12/29
018 */
019public class Kernel1D {
020        
021        private final float[] h;
022        private final int xc;
023        private final int width;
024        
025        /**
026         * Constructor.
027         * The kernel's hot spot is at its center.
028         * The kernel is normalized.
029         * 
030         * @param h the 1D kernel array
031         */
032        public Kernel1D(float[] h) {
033                this(h, (h.length - 1) / 2, true);
034        }
035        
036        /**
037         * Constructor.
038         * The hot spot index must be specified.
039         * The kernel is optionally normalized.
040         * 
041         * @param h the 1D kernel array
042         * @param xc the x-coordinate of the kernel's hot spot, default is (width-1)/2
043         * @param normalize if true the kernel is normalized (to sum = 1)
044         */
045        public Kernel1D(float[] h, int xc, boolean normalize) {
046                this.h = (normalize) ? normalize(h) : Matrix.duplicate(h);
047                this.width = h.length;
048                this.xc = xc;
049        }
050        
051        /**
052         * Returns the kernel's 1D array.
053         * @return the kernel's 1D array
054         */
055        public float[] getH() {
056                return h;
057        }
058        
059        /**
060         * Returns the width (length) of this kernel.
061         * @return the kernel's width
062         */
063        public int getWidth() {
064                return width;
065        }
066        
067        /**
068         * Returns the center coordinate of this kernel.
069         * @return the kernel's center coordinate
070         */
071        public int getXc() {
072                return xc;
073        }
074        
075        // ----------------------------------------------------------
076        
077        /**
078         * Normalizes the specified array such that its sum becomes 1. Throws an
079         * exception if the array's sum is zero. The original array is not modified.
080         * 
081         * @param A a 1D array
082         * @return the normalized array
083         * @throws ArithmeticException if array sums to zero
084         */
085        public static float[] normalize(float[] A) throws ArithmeticException {
086                double scale = 1.0 / Matrix.sum(A);
087                if (!Double.isFinite(scale))    // isZero(s)
088                        throw new ArithmeticException("zero kernel sum, cannot normalize");
089                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
090                        A[i] = (float) (A[i] * scale);
091                }
092                return A;       //Matrix.multiply((float)scale, A);
093        }
094
095}
